FuncDef:
The congest-alarm trigger-condition duration command configures a packet congestion duration for a CUSP connection.
The undo congest-alarm trigger-condition duration command restores the default packet congestion duration of a CUSP connection.
The default packet congestion duration of a CUSP connection is 5 minutes.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a packet congestion duration (min) .
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 10, in minutes, default 5.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In a CU separation scenario, you can run the congest-alarm trigger-condition duration command to configure a packet congestion duration for a CUSP connection. If packet congestion continuously occurs in the duration, an alarm is reported. By adjusting the packet congestion duration, you can monitor the packet congestion status of the CUSP connection based on alarms.
Heavier service traffic indicates severer packet congestion. To prevent frequent alarm reporting, you can set the packet congestion duration to a larger value. Use the default value unless otherwise specified.
Precautions
Heavier service traffic indicates severer packet congestion. To prevent frequent alarm reporting, you can set the packet congestion duration to a larger value. Use the default value unless otherwise specified.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
